US Army SGT Edward A. Ziarnowski enlisted in 1942, serving in the European-African Theatre until 1945 as an Auto Equipment Operator & Pistol/Rifle Marksman.

He worked at the local Chevrolet plant & became President of UAW 774, going above & beyond to provide benefits to members. https://t.co/dP45GSqX1P

name: Brian Higgins
tweet_text:
US Army Reserve SGT Renee Wiley enlisted in 1978 & worked as an Emergency Treatment NCO, providing outpatient care. While rising to Drill Sergeant, she also served as a Sex Crimes Investigator.

Wiley earned the Army Reserve Components Achievement Medal & several others. https://t.co/WJz02EyWgn

name: Brian Higgins
tweet_text: US Army SSG Tommie Wagstaff enlisted in 1992 & served for over 20 years. He received honorable remarks throughout this career. Wagstaff's dedicated service & leadership earned him a National Defense Service Medal & an Army Reserve Components Achievement Medal, among many others. https://t.co/FDrQTKH8h9

name: Brian Higgins
tweet_text:
US Army SSG Richard Reisch deployed to Vietnam in 1970 & fought in combat until 1971. He was then stationed at Ft. Bragg & Fort Monmouth as Signal School Instructor before transferring to Berlin.

Reisch earned a Bronze Star while serving in Vietnam, among several other honors. https://t.co/oWQPmUh50n

name: Brian Higgins
tweet_text:
US Navy Coxwain Jody Murphy enlisted in 1943 becoming a member of the Special Forces Navy Frogman Underwater Demolition Team. He also served on the USS Melville & USS Circle in the Pacific Theater.

He earned an Asiatic Pacific Campaign Medal w/ 1 bronze service star, & others. https://t.co/AEC9KuKbxq

name: Brian Higgins
tweet_text:
US Marine Corps Corporal Monica Lynch deployed to Saudi Arabia & the Emirate of Kuwait, participating in ground combat during Operation Desert Storm & Shield.

She is one of the first Black women from WNY to serve in combat & receive the Combat Action Ribbon as Marine. https://t.co/JC9DAuzktS

name: Brian Higgins
tweet_text:
Radio Operator Wade Lewis enlisted in the U.S. Navy at age 19. A trailblazer as an African American soldier during in the Korean War, he served on the USS Greenwood.

Lewis received a National Defense Service Medal among several other military honors. https://t.co/afDnkh1Twi

name: Brian Higgins
tweet_text: Specialist Rose Hyman, a Buffalo native, served in the U.S. Army from 1985-1989. After honorably discharging, she continued to serve her country. name: Brian Higgins
tweet_text:

Harrison never missed the enemy, earning the nickname "Hawkeyes". He is a Bronze Star recipient among several other honors. https://t.co/wwYoex3BNP

name: Brian Higgins

Q: My spouse passed away; am I entitled to receive Social Security benefits?

A: Following a death, family members might be eligible to receive monthly Social Security benefits. You can report a death to the SSA using 1-800-772-1213. For more info go to https://t.co/WhfJyF8FUH. https://t.co/vYCg2SZq2E

name: Brian Higgins
tweet_text:
Q: How can I get a replacement Social Security card?

A: A new card is free and can be requested online by creating or accessing your ‚Äúmy Social Security account‚Äù at https://t.co/E6lPDkx85F. If you don‚Äôt have web access call the toll-free number at 1-800-772-1213. https://t.co/RY71vydohI

name: Brian Higgins
tweet_text:
